title: Optional KEK failures now skip the entire test class in `@Before`
problem: `Assume.assumeTrue(false)` is called inside `setUp()`. In JUnit 4 this aborts each test before execution, including tests that do not depend on KEK/session-key setup (for example external-key API tests). This regresses coverage and can hide real failures.

title: Treating unsupported access-right API as full test skip drops valid internal-sign coverage
problem: `SDF_GetPrivateKeyAccessRight` can be unsupported on some devices while internal signing/verifying still works. The new logic now skips the whole test immediately, so a working `SDF_InternalSign_ECC/SDF_InternalVerify_ECC` path is never exercised.

title: Optional validation step now converts a successful key-generation test into “skipped”
problem: This catch block is inside `testGenerateKeyWithIPK_ECC` after key generation assertions already passed. If symmetric encrypt/decrypt is unsupported, the test is marked skipped, which hides successful verification of `SDF_GenerateKeyWithIPK_ECC` and weakens regression detection.

title: `assertNotNull` used on primitive-returning getters creates no-op assertions
problem: `getDeviceVersion()`, `getStandardVersion()`, and `getBufferSize()` return primitives (`long`). `assertNotNull` on primitives always passes due autoboxing, so these checks do not validate anything.
